Apply to the face and neck underneath your regular skincare cream. It is to be used as an intensive treatment, based on the skin's specific needs. Tone and suppleness is restored and the skin is left radiantly beautiful and has a more youthful appearance.

Our serum has a shelf life of 2 years. No other L-Ascorbic product is this stable and effective. The formula contains additional ingredients Hyaluronic Acid, Vitamin E, and Aloe. Vitamin C vs. Free Radicals Vitamin antioxidants that can improve the appearance of fine lines on the skin include vitamin E and C, as well as the retinoids, which are derivatives of vitamin A. Antioxidants are thought to be beneficial due to their ability to reduce, neutralize, and prevent the damage done to the body by free radicals. Free radicals are unstable oxygen molecules that your body produces through metabolic processes, such as food absorption, and via ingestion of toxins from dietary sources, or exposure to air pollution. Basically, during the course of daily life, you are constantly subjected to potential sources that promote free radical production. It is thought that the multiple benefits of antioxidants include their ability to reduce free radical damage by blocking the oxidative processes in cells, inhibit inflammation that leads to collagen depletion, and offer protective assistance against sun damage and skin cancer.

These phenomena can be due to external factors (sun exposure, pollution, smoking, etc.) and internal factors (age, etc.). These factors favour the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles which give a dull and aged aspect to the skin. Furthermore, the concentration of vitamin C in the skin falls with age and exposure to UV rays, which has the effect of reducing the synthesis of collagen. Collagen is a protein which confers a resistance to stretching on the tissues. To deal with this fall, the vitamin C concentration in the skin must be increased in order to maintain an optimal collagen level and to keep the skin young, soft and radiant. For all skin types. Apply a few drops of Flavo-C forte to the tips of the fingers, and then spread over the areas to be treated (face, eye contours, neckline), morning and evening, paying particular attention to the areas most affected by time (lip contours, crow’s feet, frown lines).
